body_html: Since it hasn't been mentioned on this thread yet (I mentioned it to @cpuhrsch in person); now that we have a new layout parameter, you could toggle between contiguous non-contiguous output by specifying the layout torch.add(x, y, layout=torch.noncontiguous) (default is contiguous dense :)
body_text: Since it hasn't been mentioned on this thread yet (I mentioned it to @cpuhrsch in person); now that we have a new layout parameter, you could toggle between contiguous non-contiguous output by specifying the layout torch.add(x, y, layout=torch.noncontiguous) (default is contiguous dense :)
body: Since it hasn't been mentioned on this thread yet (I mentioned it to @cpuhrsch in person); now that we have a new `layout` parameter, you could toggle between contiguous non-contiguous output by specifying the layout `torch.add(x, y, layout=torch.noncontiguous)` (default is contiguous dense :)
